item.title: Jon add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description:
"In a strange room you must empty yourself for sleep. And before you are emptied for sleep, what are you. And when you are emptied for sleep, you are not. And when you are filled with sleep, you never were. I don't know what I am. I don't know if I am or not. Jewel knows he is, because he does not know that he does not know whether he is or not. He cannot empty himself for sleep because he is not what he is and he is what he is not. Beyond the unlamped wall I can hear the rain shaping the wagon that is ours, the load that is no longer theirs that felled and sawed it nor yet theirs that bought it and which is not ours either, lie on our wagon though it does, since only the wind and the rain shape it only to Jewel and me, that are not asleep. And since sleep is is-not and rain and wind are <i>was</i>, it is not. Yet the wagon <i>is</i>, because when the wagon is <i>was</i>, Addie Bundren will not be. And Jewel <i>is</i>, so Addie Bundren must be. And then I must be, or I could not empty myself for sleep in a strange room. And so if I am not emptied yet, I am <i>is</i>.
How often have I lain beneath rain on a strange roof, thinking of home." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Jon add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "Rosencrantz: I don't believe in it anyway. Guildenstern: What? Rosencrantz: England. Guildenstern: Just a conspiracy of cartographers, then? " -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Jon add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "Rosencrantz: We might as well be dead. Do you think death could possibly be a boat? Guildenstern: No, no, no... Death is...not. Death isn't. You take my meaning. Death is the ultimate negative. Not-being. You can't not-be on a boat. Rosencrantz: I've frequently not been on boats. Guildenstern: No, no, no--what you've been is not on boats." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Jon add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "They're trying to kill me," Yossarian told him calmly. No one's trying to kill you," Clevinger cried. Then why are they shooting at me?" Yossarian asked. They're shooting at everyone," Clevinger answered. "They're trying to kill everyone." And what difference does that make?" -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Jon add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description:
"There was only one catch and that was Catch-22, which specified that a concern for one's safety in the face of dangers that were real and immediate was the process of a rational mind. Orr was crazy and could be grounded. All he had to do was ask; and as soon as he did, he would no longer be crazy and would have to fly more missions. Orr would be crazy to fly more missions and sane if he didn't, but if he was sane he had to fly them. If he flew them he was crazy and didn't have to; but if he didn't want to he was sane and had to. Yossarian was moved very deeply by the absolute simplicity of this clause of Catch-22 and let out a respectful whistle.
"That's some catch, that Catch-22," he observed.
"It's the best there is," Doc Daneeka agreed." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Jon add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "Just because you're paranoid doesn't mean they aren't after you" -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Jon add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description:
"Sure, that's what I mean,' Doc Daneeka said. 'A little grease is what makes this world go round. One hand washes the other. Know what I mean? You scratch my back, I'll scratch yours.'
Yossarian knew what he meant.
That's not what I meant,' Doc Daneeka said, as Yossarian began scratching his back." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Jon add a quote by Joseph Heller
Jon add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "He had decided to live forever or die in the attempt." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Jon add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "He was sick with lust and mesmerized with regret" -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Jon add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "But that was war. Just about all he could find in its favor was that it paid well and liberated children from the pernicious influence of their parents." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Jon add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "Some men are born mediocre, some men achieve mediocrity, and some men have mediocrity trust upon them." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Jon add a quote by Joseph Heller
Jon add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "There was no telling what people might find out once they felt free to ask whatever questions they wanted to." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Jon add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "Like Olympic medals and tennis trophies, all the signified was that the owner had done something of no benefit to anyone more capably than everyone else." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Jon add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "No sympathy for the devil; keep that in mind. Buy the ticket, take the ride...and if it occasionally gets a little heavier than what you had in mind, well...maybe chalk it off to forced conscious expansion: Tune in, freak out, get beaten." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Jon add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Good people drink good beer." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Jon add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Buy the ticket, take the ride." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Jon add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "We were somewhere around Barstow, on the edge of the desert, when the drugs began to take hold." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Jon add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "My mother is a fish." -- William Faulkner
